On the bank of the CandabhÄgÄ River,
I was a monkey at that time;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
sitting in the midst of a mountain.
Shining in all directions,
like a blossoming coral tree;
Endowed with the major and minor marks,
seeing him, I was delighted.
With uplifted mind, joyful,
with a mind elated with rapture;
I placed three blue lotus flowers
on his head.
Having worshipped the flowers
of the great sage Phussa,
with respect,
I departed facing north.
As I was going, with a crooked body,
with a serene mind;
Having fallen into a mountain cave,
I reached the end of my life.
By that well-done deed,
and by my intention and aspiration;
